content.text: In this lesson, you'll learn how to talk about your hobbies and ask someone about theirs. Let's start with the basics.

data.phrase: Wat doe jij in je vrije tijd?
data.meaning: What do you do in your free time?

content.text: To say what you like, you can use the phrase 'Ik vind ... leuk', which means 'I like...'.

data.tip: The 'eu' sound is unique to Dutch. It's similar to the 'oy' in 'boy' but with rounded lips.

content.text: You can also say how often you do something.

content.title: Sharing Your Hobbies
content.setting: You are at a social event and meet Eva. She starts a conversation with you.

conversation_flow.title: Listen to the opening question
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Hallo! Wat doe jij in je vrije tijd?

conversation_flow.title: Mention a sport you enjoy
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Oh, leuk! Doe je nog iets anders?

extract_info.hobby_1: Extract the first hobby mentioned by the user

conversation_flow.title: Mention another activity
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Interessant. Hoe vaak doe je dat?

extract_info.hobby_2: Extract the second hobby mentioned by the user

conversation_flow.title: Say how often you do one of your hobbies

content.text: Great! Now let's learn how to give more details, like explaining *why* you like a hobby.
To say 'because', use the word 'omdat'. In a simple sentence like this, the structure is 'omdat het ... is'.
To say you *don't* like something, add the word 'niet' after the verb. For example: 'Ik vind ... niet leuk'.
To talk about your plans, you can use the verb 'gaan' (to go). 'Ik ga' means 'I am going to'.

content.title: Giving More Detail
content.setting: Eva is curious and wants to know more about your hobbies.

conversation_flow.title: Explain why you like your hobby
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Dat snap ik. Is er ook iets wat je niet leuk vindt?

conversation_flow.title: Mention something you don't like to do
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Oké! En wat ga je dit weekend doen?

conversation_flow.title: Say what you are going to do this weekend

content.text: Good job! Now, it's your turn to ask Eva about her hobbies.
To ask a follow-up question, you can use question words like 'Waar?'.
Finally, let's learn how to react positively to someone's answer.

content.title: Asking About Their Hobbies
content.setting: You've shared your plans. Now, show interest in Eva's hobbies to keep the conversation going.

conversation_flow.title: Ask what she likes to do
Express that you find their hobby interesting
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Dank je! Leuk om je te ontmoeten.
